result.execSummary:
The defendant James W Pfeiffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge 
Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for 
Substance Abuse Program. 
Sentence credit of 225 days were granted it imposed.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Restitution for US Bank to be paid Joint and Several as a condition of probation. To be paid before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
30 DAYS - DAY REPORT CENTER - Consecutive to Huber. NO Good Time while on DRC. If defendant successfully completes the DRC, the 30 Days of Stayed Huber will be permanently Stayed.

No Contact with the co-defendants or with the victims/businesses listed int he criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge if imposed. Mainatin employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. To commence 12/14/16 by 5pm. Last 30 days Stayed for Day Report Center

DRC informational court report dated March 8, 2017.
Motion to Modify Sentence is denied. Signed by Judge Carter on 12/14/16.
The Defendant's report date has been changed from 12/14/16 at 5:00 pm, to 12/26/16 by 5:00 pm.   Signed by Judge Carter on 12/14/16.
Defendant's Motion to Change Report Date. Filed by Atty Kershek.

Defendant's Motion to Modify Sentence. Filed by Atty Kershek.

12/14/16,   per Judge Carter: The court addressed sentencing by considering all of the information supplied at the sentencing hearing and ordered jail time based primarily on the nature and seriousness of the offense and the fact that to not impose jail would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense.  This additional information regarding the Defendant's character would not change the court's original assessment, nor the court's ultimate sentence. Order will be prepared.

Defendant James W Pfeiffer in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Fallon H. makes statements.  Defendant make statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #4:  IMPOSED & STAYED SENTENCE OF:

3  YEARS IMPRISONMENT  (225 Days credit)    *CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OITHER SENTENCE*
  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINMENT
  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-Defendants or with victim/victim businesses listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $676.85 - to US Bank (Joint and several)  -  to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  90 DAYS,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 12/14/16 by 5:00 P.M. - LAST 30 DAYS STAYED FOR 30 DAYS DAY REPORT CENTER

DAY REPORT CENTER:  30 DAYS, Consecutive to huber sentence.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If Defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 30 days of huber stayed will be permanently stayed.  

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
Sentencing hearing on December 7, 2016 at 09:45 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant James W Pfeiffer in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #4.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #4.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.   Court sets sentencing hearing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 09:45 am.
